line_1: Nor tempts he yet the plain but, hurled upright,
line_2: Emits the mass, a prelude of his might.

line_1: Those hearts should be reclaim'd, renew'd, upright.
line_2: And, farewell else all hope of pure delight,

line_1: Unless on the head each hair stands upright;
line_2: For who can appear in a place so polite,
And eke with all his might.

line_1: To meet men always bolt upright,
line_2: For how fantastick is the sight,

line_1: Unbending as a Ghost, she stalks upright,
line_2: Tho' when she comes forth into public sight,

line_1: When freshen'd Grass now bears it self upright,
line_2: And makes cool Banks to pleasing Rest invite,
